content: I've been experimenting with different shutter speeds and aperture settings for sunrise and sunset shoots, and I'm really interested in capturing more ocean views and beach scenes. Speaking of silhouettes, I've been trying to capture the perfect one during these times, especially when it comes to exposing for the sky and the foreground. Do you have any tips on how to capture the perfect silhouette when there are people or objects in the foreground, like surfers or beach structures?
